revised_title: Gaseous Combustion in Electric Discharges: Part I - Combustion of Electrolytic Gas in Direct Current Discharges
tldr: The authors investigated the combustion of electrolytic gas in direct current discharges, discovering that the rate of chemical change is directly proportional to the current passing through the discharge. This relationship is independent of potential fall between the electrodes, gas pressure, and temperature. The findings provide insight into the electrical ignition of gases and the pre-ignition stage of combustion.
